The above are designed to handle very large boards, but can be used with low traffic websites.
All PHP
PhpBB http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PhpBB free and open Source, requires MySQL.
Great for running on run-of-the-mill LAMP configurations.
I would use Vanilla forums in your case.
It has a great API for integrating into other projects as well.
Or if you prefer the more traditional forum layout see PunBB.
I would not recommend phpBB for a low volume forum as it is more complicated to setup and maintain.
It is also a much larger app and not lightweight at all.
PhpBB is an excellent.
It's very easy to set up and has many great features, but it is more difficult to customize right out of the box.
For a superfast "community" solution, try using WordPress with the BuddyPress plugin.
I can recommend MyLittleForum.
It's actually not a board, but a forum, but one of the views (with compacted threads) looks pretty much board-like.
http://mylittleforum.net/forum/index.php?mode=index
